Black tries to counterattack with 6...Nc6, but White responds with 7.Bg5, attacking the knight and preparing to launch a kingside attack. Black recaptures with 7... xf6, but White is ready with 8.O-O, developing the king and supporting the attack on the queenside. The position becomes increasingly complex as White launches a fierce attack on the black position (9.Rad1, 10.a4), aiming to break through and create threats on multiple fronts.
